thread.title: Telco complaints drop for a fourth year
thread.title_full: Telco complaints drop for a fourth year

title: Telco complaints drop for a fourth year
text:
Print 
Phone and internet users are finding less to whine about, with telco complaints falling for the fourth consecutive year. 
Consumers made more than 124,000 complaints about mobile, internet and landline services last financial year, according to a report released by the Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman on Friday. 
While the total number of complaints dropped 10.5 per cent in 2014-15, Acting Ombudsman Diane Carmody said the industry still has a long way to go, noting an almost 70 per cent increase in the number of NBN-related complaints. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Telco complaints drop for a fourth year AAP
